fields.headline: The Budget at a glance
fields.bodyText: Economic forecasts · Inflation at 2.3% predicted to rise to 2.5% next year and beyond - less than previous forecasts · Fixed investment in business expected to grow by 4.25% to 4.75% · Consumption to grow by 2.5% · Manufacturing output to grow by 0.25 to 0.75% this year Borrowing · Assessment on euro entry by June 7 · Brown: 'prudent to borrow now' · Debt ratio 32.2% this year rising to 33.8% by 2007 - lowest among all UK competitors Growth · 2% average growth over 2001-02 - higher than USA, Japan and eurozone · Growth forecast to be 2% to 2.5%, making UK, with the US, the fastest growing G7 economy · Domestic demand expected to grow by 3% to 3.5% this year Military spending and the war · Military spending is priority · £330m for counter-terrorism airport security · £3bn in reserve for MoD · Brown pays tribute to Blair's war leadership International development · Extra £64m for humanitarian aid to Iraq · Plans for £50bn fund for primary education and healthcare in developing world Welfare and benefits · Child trust fund for every child born from September 2002 · Shake-up of housing benefits to make it easier for job-hunters and lone parents · On course to meet child poverty targets · From next April, new housing benefit rules for people taking up jobs · Weekly signing-on to replace fortnightly rule · Incapacity benefit to rise by £19 a week Employment · 253,000 new jobs created · Fewer than 1m claiming unemployment benefit for first time since 1974 · Skilled migrants admission made easier · Those searching for a job for more than 13 weeks will have to extend search to 90 minutes travel time to workplace · Young offenders who behave well in custody to be offered job on release · Help for lone parents working part-time · Extra £20 a week for lone parents' job search · Relocation of some of civil service to regions · Job Centres to get discretionary powers · £170m new help for training costs of people in work Health · By 2008, 88,000 more nurses and 25,000 more doctors, funded by NI increase Education · Greater freedoms for local authorities Research and development · Bid to raise R&D funding from 1.9% to 2.8% this year · R&D tax credits to be expanded · Tax help for stem cell research Regional development · Regional inflation figures to be produced · Remits for pay review bodies to include strong regional dimension Small businesses · Bid to boost investment in small businesses who struggle to raise equity · 3 new tax reliefs for small and medium enterprises · 500 small business regulations to go · New £56,000 VAT tax threshold · Corporation tax frozen · IT investment allowances extended · Exemption on stamp duty for commercial property to rise from £60,000 to £150,000, with exempt leases up to £150,000. Pensioners · Free hospital meals for pensioners · Extra £100 on winter fuel payment for over 80s · From October all single pensioners with income below £139 a week and all couples below £203 a week will benefit from new pension credit. Cigarettes and alcohol · 1p tax on pint of beer · 4p on bottle of wine · Tax on spirits frozen for 6th consecutive year · Duty on cider and sparkling wine frozen · 8p on pack of cigarettes Transport · £5 on car tax · 1.28p rise in duties on petrol deferred for 6 months · Bio-ethanol duty lowered by 20p · Air passenger duty frozen · Vehicle excise duty on lorries and motorbikes frozen Gambling · Direct tax on bingo to be scrapped Property · Stamp duty frozen on homes and commercial properties · Stamp duty tax avoidance to be curbed in new bill · Review of home loans and supply of homes Inheritance tax · Threshold up to £255,000
